content:
Hello there

I recommend to compact the inbox. Find the buttons to compact the inbox , select the inbox folder and go to file>Compact folders and use in the menu compact folders to click on it. Select the inbox folder and then use  : File -> Compact Folders to compact it.

Recent e-mail s can quickly be moved to other places before the compacting starts so you can quickly reach out to them in a safe new folder on the desktop in a new present submap. Try to configure Thunderbird to automaticly compact folders to prevent situations like this. Keep a weekly or daily routine to control if these new settings work fine and well.

If these settings above does work fine but the issue is still there then you can go and see if some configurations settings are there in the filter settings that you had configured if there are to much filters that you have installed recent you have to delete some of them or all filters to see if the problem is vanished now. Filter deleting and configuration is one of the possible solving subjects here.
creator: Googlethunderbird

content:
> Issue #1: This command used to go through my accounts within several seconds; but now this can take several minutes.

It just appears to be slower. We increased the display time of notices in the status bar (at the bottom) so users could actually read them.

If you don't get an answer on #2, please post it as a separate question - it is most effective to create one question for each issue.
creator: wsmwk

content:
Wayne Mery said
> Issue #1: It just appears to be slower. We increased the display time of notices in the status bar (at the bottom) so users could actually read them.

These notices are kind of generic, and inconsequential anyway, since anything of significance would generate a popup. So the move to make them slower seems very poorly thought out. Plus they are so slow that it seems like something else is going on with server communication. Seems like they've actually created a bug.

Thanks for your reply.

content: There may be special software that could dig remnants from that formatted drive, but I would say it's a lost cause.
creator: davidsk

content:
It's quite common to remove old hard disk and connect to new computer even as an external drive. The main purpose of the inital connection being to copy important files over to the new drives on new computer. But it sounds like you omited to do this before reformatting.

There are products which claim they can help, but I cannot verify anything. Take a look at the following : https://www.easeus.com/ad/format-recovery.htm https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/discussions/windowsinsiderprogram/how-can-i-recover-files-from-a-formatted-hard-drive/4394383

Without any recovery Address books would be lost, but whether you can still have emails depends upon whether you have emails on server.

If you used IMAP accounts previously then all data/emails should still be on the server. Create a new existing mail account for email address and set it up as imap account. Then you can subscribe to see various folders on the server.

If you used Pop accounts then maybe many will still be on server. It depends upon whether you set previous account to 'Leave messages on server'.
creator: Toad-Hall

creator: wsmwk

content:
Please check you have the following on computer so that nothing is preventing access to internet etc.

Firewall Access Firewall, this might be the default on computer or controlled by an Anti-Virus you installed. The Thunderbird program must be set up as an allowed program. Please confirm you have this set up.

Anti-Virus: This might be set up to auto scan any file that gets opened etc, so could be causing an interference when Thunderbird is starting up or even when attempting to download. I would advise that you set up an exemption to not scan your Thunderbird folder that contains all info on profile(s). If you downloaded Thunderbird from the official website : https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/all/ Then the profile will by default be here: C:/Users/username/Appdata/Roaming/Thunderbird

Another way to check if AV is an issue: Restart computer in 'Safe mode with Networking' mode - please note you will need to use an ethernet cable to connect computer to router as it will not work using wireless connection.

VPN Please check your computer to see if you have enabled a VPN. Many Anti-Virus products now offer a VPN and some auto enable it. I use Norton365 and after an update discovered it has auto enabled a VPN which basically caused all kinds of issues. Most servers do not like VPN because it hides the expected IP address, so server blocks access because it thinks you are a hacker. Switch off the VPN or you can create a split tunnelling and set up Thunderbird to use it.

I also use BT. I have both Pop and Imap account connections to the BT server. I am not experiencing any issues with download at this moment. All accounts are ok. I'm testing this in both 128.11.1esr and a beta 140.0b2

Are you able to logon to BT webmail account via a browser ? I ask this because last week it did go down. It will also confirm you know the correct password and that it works. Please confirm you can access BT webmail account.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Hello Les We have read the message. We try to help.

The security exceptions what do they say at the moment? I know , Some certifications are not up to date or missing or the certification library is infected. Or the certification had been damaged or suddenly has been corrupted on their way to the program. Or there is no certification at all on that system for the Thunderbird software now. They are designed to protect you from treath s in the program.

The SSL/Tls certification is missing or damaged. You can choose in a pop up message to confirm to that missing certificatie message and restart the software and you can go in? But the message is coming over and over again. Am i right?
creator: Googlethunderbird

content:
Hello there


Certifications are not accepted. To stop it is to solve it. Let Thunderbird recreate the situation by deleting the primair certification.(cert8.db) The certificate is in the Thunderbird profile and is called cert8.db by deleting that certificate and restart Thunderbird again it creates the same certificate but freshly now. If that problem keep on occuring the same way it might be that the server connection is not good. Or trusted certifications are not added as trusted to the list. An infected certification store or Library are rare to find.
creator: Googlethunderbird
